page_title_en: CoD: Warzone DMZ Mode - Everything We Learned From The Live Reveal
page_title_ko: CoD: Warzone DMZ 모드 - 라이브 공개에서 배운 모든 것
page_title_cn: CoD：战区 DMZ 模式 - 我们从直播中学到的一切
page_description_en: Here is everything we learned during the live reveal of Warzone's DMZ mode.
page_description_ko: 다음은 Warzone의 DMZ 모드를 라이브로 공개하는 동안 배운 모든 것입니다.
page_description_cn: 这是我们在 Warzone 的 DMZ 模式现场展示中学到的一切。
page_text_html:
Call of Duty: Warzone 2.0 launches on November 16 with the start of Modern Warfare 2: Season 1, and the game launches with Call of Duty's new DMZ extraction mode. Activision has been light on the details, but content creators were able to livestream gameplay of DMZ during a reveal event on November 9. Here we break down everything we learned about DMZ from the event.

DMZ Mode Explained

Activision's official description of the mode says, "DMZ is an open-world, narrative-focused extraction mode where Operator squads have free rein to complete faction-based missions, take on additional side objectives, engage with enemy Operators or AI combatants, and search for valuable items, all while fighting to survive toward exfiltration."

Now Playing: COD Warzone 2.0 New Gulag & Map Explained | GameSpot News

The new DMZ mode seems to be Call of Duty's take on the extraction shooter genre, with players dropping in as trios on Warzone's Al Mazrah map to loot, fight, and extract. There are objectives players can complete for XP and cash, and players have the choice of how they want to play. They can just drop into a match for looting, they can choose to look for gunfights, or try to complete specific objectives.

Just like other extraction shooters like Escape From Tarkov and Hunt: Showdown, players can keep all the weapons and loot earned from a successful extraction, while also losing everything if they die before extraction.

Uses Warzone 2.0 features

Players can expect DMZ to utilize many features and mechanics from Warzone 2.0. This includes the new Stronghold locations on Al Mazrah. Looting and scavenging keys will let players access the high-tier loot found within the locked Stronghold buildings. There are several Stronghold locations on the map, and each key is assigned to a specific Stronghold. Players have the choice to enter the Stronghold and clear out any AI opponents for random high-tier loot, or the keys can be sold at Buy Stations for cash.

Modern Warfare 2's AI enemies are found all throughout the map. There are recruit (easy) level AIs that can be found scattered around in buildings and various locations, but AI near Strongholds or objective areas are often armored and much more challenging to fight.

There's also a backpack system in DMZ, and players start with a small pack that holds five items. However, larger backpacks can be scavenged or purchased from Buy Stations. This lets players store valuables such as items needed for objectives or random junk with price tags that can be sold for cash. These items include things like food, comic books, batteries, and tools. Some tools appear to be useful, but it's unclear how many will have uses beyond just looting for cash. However, drills can be looted and used to open safes, which usually contain tons of cash and useful items like UAVs.

There's a big emphasis on scoring tons of money in DMZ, and it's likely because high-tier items at the Buy Station cost large sums of cash. The Advanced UAV streak, which reveals all players on the map for a limited time, costs $12,000 per streak. Upgrading to a medium backpacks cost $5,000, and two-plate armored vests cost $7,500.

DMZ also gives full use of all of Al Mazrah's vehicles, which no longer have unlimited fuel capacity. Players will need to refuel vehicles with scavenged gas cans or at gas stations to keep rolling through a match.

There's a new interrogation feature in both modes. This works much like the operator ability for Caveira in Rainbow Six Siege, where knocking an opponent will let a player "interrogate" them to reveal the location of their squadmates on the map.

Additionally, there is one thing that seems exclusive to DMZ. Players can revive eliminated squadmates at their death location at any time in the match. Dead teammates are marked as a blue health icon, and there is no time limit or any additional steps needed to return teammates to the match.

The reveal event didn't really showcase the overall rewards and long-term incentives for playing DMZ and having successful extractions. However, Activision did announce more information will be revealed ahead of next week's launch.

Season 1 of Modern Warfare 2 and Warzone 2.0 is bringing plenty of new content and changes, including an overhauled battle pass and a major change to the seasonal Prestige system. Call of Duty is also bringing three of the world's most famous soccer/football players to Modern Warfare 2 and Warzone 2.0, with the Modern Warfare FC event beginning after the launch of Season 1.

page_text_en:
Call of Duty: Warzone 2.0 launches on November 16 with the start of Modern Warfare 2: Season 1, and the game launches with Call of Duty's new DMZ extraction mode. Activision has been light on the details, but content creators were able to livestream gameplay of DMZ during a reveal event on November 9. Here we break down everything we learned about DMZ from the event.

DMZ Mode Explained

Activision's official description of the mode says, "DMZ is an open-world, narrative-focused extraction mode where Operator squads have free rein to complete faction-based missions, take on additional side objectives, engage with enemy Operators or AI combatants, and search for valuable items, all while fighting to survive toward exfiltration."

Now Playing: COD Warzone 2.0 New Gulag & Map Explained | GameSpot News

The new DMZ mode seems to be Call of Duty's take on the extraction shooter genre, with players dropping in as trios on Warzone's Al Mazrah map to loot, fight, and extract. There are objectives players can complete for XP and cash, and players have the choice of how they want to play. They can just drop into a match for looting, they can choose to look for gunfights, or try to complete specific objectives.

Just like other extraction shooters like Escape From Tarkov and Hunt: Showdown, players can keep all the weapons and loot earned from a successful extraction, while also losing everything if they die before extraction.

Uses Warzone 2.0 features

Players can expect DMZ to utilize many features and mechanics from Warzone 2.0. This includes the new Stronghold locations on Al Mazrah. Looting and scavenging keys will let players access the high-tier loot found within the locked Stronghold buildings. There are several Stronghold locations on the map, and each key is assigned to a specific Stronghold. Players have the choice to enter the Stronghold and clear out any AI opponents for random high-tier loot, or the keys can be sold at Buy Stations for cash.

Modern Warfare 2's AI enemies are found all throughout the map. There are recruit (easy) level AIs that can be found scattered around in buildings and various locations, but AI near Strongholds or objective areas are often armored and much more challenging to fight.

There's also a backpack system in DMZ, and players start with a small pack that holds five items. However, larger backpacks can be scavenged or purchased from Buy Stations. This lets players store valuables such as items needed for objectives or random junk with price tags that can be sold for cash. These items include things like food, comic books, batteries, and tools. Some tools appear to be useful, but it's unclear how many will have uses beyond just looting for cash. However, drills can be looted and used to open safes, which usually contain tons of cash and useful items like UAVs.

There's a big emphasis on scoring tons of money in DMZ, and it's likely because high-tier items at the Buy Station cost large sums of cash. The Advanced UAV streak, which reveals all players on the map for a limited time, costs $12,000 per streak. Upgrading to a medium backpacks cost $5,000, and two-plate armored vests cost $7,500.

Warzone and DMZ Stronghold location

DMZ also gives full use of all of Al Mazrah's vehicles, which no longer have unlimited fuel capacity. Players will need to refuel vehicles with scavenged gas cans or at gas stations to keep rolling through a match.

There's a new interrogation feature in both modes. This works much like the operator ability for Caveira in Rainbow Six Siege, where knocking an opponent will let a player "interrogate" them to reveal the location of their squadmates on the map.

Additionally, there is one thing that seems exclusive to DMZ. Players can revive eliminated squadmates at their death location at any time in the match. Dead teammates are marked as a blue health icon, and there is no time limit or any additional steps needed to return teammates to the match.

The reveal event didn't really showcase the overall rewards and long-term incentives for playing DMZ and having successful extractions. However, Activision did announce more information will be revealed ahead of next week's launch.

Season 1 of Modern Warfare 2 and Warzone 2.0 is bringing plenty of new content and changes, including an overhauled battle pass and a major change to the seasonal Prestige system. Call of Duty is also bringing three of the world's most famous soccer/football players to Modern Warfare 2 and Warzone 2.0, with the Modern Warfare FC event beginning after the launch of Season 1.

page_text_ko:
Call of Duty: Warzone 2.0은 Modern Warfare 2: 시즌 1의 시작과 함께 11월 16일에 출시되며 게임은 Call of Duty의 새로운 DMZ 추출 모드와 함께 출시됩니다. Activision은 세부 사항에 대해 밝히지 않았지만 콘텐츠 제작자는 11월 9일 공개 이벤트에서 DMZ의 게임 플레이를 라이브 스트리밍할 수 있었습니다. 여기에서 이벤트에서 DMZ에 대해 배운 모든 내용을 분석합니다.
DMZ 모드 설명
모드에 대한 Activision의 공식 설명은 "DMZ는 오퍼레이터 분대가 진영 기반 임무를 완수하고, 추가 측면 목표를 수행하고, 적 오퍼레이터 또는 AI 전투원과 교전하고, 귀중한 아이템을 위해, 탈출을 위해 생존을 위해 싸우는 동안."
지금 재생 중: COD Warzone 2.0 New Gulag 및 지도 설명 | 게임스팟 뉴스
새로운 DMZ 모드는 플레이어가 Warzone의 Al Mazrah 지도에서 약탈하고, 싸우고, 추출하기 위해 트리오로 떨어지는 추출 슈팅 장르에 대한 Call of Duty의 테이크 인 것 같습니다. 플레이어가 XP와 현금으로 완료할 수 있는 목표가 있으며 플레이어는 원하는 플레이 방식을 선택할 수 있습니다. 그들은 약탈을 위해 경기에 뛰어들 수 있고, 총격전을 찾거나 특정 목표를 완료하려고 할 수 있습니다.
Escape From Tarkov 및 Hunt: Showdown과 같은 다른 추출 슈팅 게임과 마찬가지로 플레이어는 성공적인 추출에서 얻은 모든 무기와 전리품을 유지할 수 있으며 추출 전에 죽으면 모든 것을 잃을 수도 있습니다.
Warzone 2.0 기능 사용
플레이어는 DMZ가 Warzone 2.0의 많은 기능과 메커니즘을 활용할 것으로 기대할 수 있습니다. 여기에는 Al Mazrah의 새로운 요새 위치가 포함됩니다. 약탈 및 청소 열쇠를 통해 플레이어는 잠긴 스트롱홀드 건물 내에서 찾을 수 있는 높은 등급의 전리품에 접근할 수 있습니다. 지도에는 여러 스트롱홀드 위치가 있으며 각 키는 특정 스트롱홀드에 할당됩니다. 플레이어는 스트롱홀드에 들어가 임의의 상위 등급 전리품을 얻기 위해 AI 상대를 제거하거나 구매 스테이션에서 키를 현금으로 판매할 수 있습니다.
Modern Warfare 2의 AI 적들은 지도 전체에서 발견됩니다. 건물과 다양한 위치에 흩어져 있는 신병(쉬운) 수준의 AI가 있지만 요새나 목표 지역 근처의 AI는 종종 무장하고 싸우기가 훨씬 더 어렵습니다.
DMZ에는 백팩 시스템도 있으며 플레이어는 5개의 아이템이 들어 있는 작은 팩으로 시작합니다. 그러나 더 큰 배낭은 수집하거나 구매 스테이션에서 구입할 수 있습니다. 이를 통해 플레이어는 목표에 필요한 항목 또는 현금으로 판매할 수 있는 가격표가 있는 임의 쓰레기와 같은 귀중품을 저장할 수 있습니다. 이러한 항목에는 음식, 만화책, 배터리, 도구 등이 포함됩니다. 일부 도구는 유용해 보이지만 현금을 약탈하는 것 이상으로 얼마나 많은 도구가 사용되는지는 확실하지 않습니다. 그러나 드릴을 약탈하여 금고를 여는 데 사용할 수 있습니다. 금고에는 일반적으로 수많은 현금과 UAV와 같은 유용한 아이템이 들어 있습니다.
DMZ에서 엄청난 돈을 버는 것에 중점을 두고 있으며, Buy Station의 고급 아이템은 많은 현금이 들기 때문일 수 있습니다. 제한된 시간 동안 지도에 있는 모든 플레이어를 공개하는 고급 UAV 행진은 연승당 $12,000입니다. 중형 백팩으로 업그레이드하는 데 드는 비용은 $5,000이고 이중 장갑 조끼는 $7,500입니다.
워존 및 DMZ 거점 위치
DMZ는 또한 더 이상 연료 용량이 무제한이 아닌 Al Mazrah의 모든 차량을 최대한 활용할 수 있습니다. 플레이어는 매치를 계속 진행하려면 주유소나 청소한 주유소로 차량에 연료를 보급해야 합니다.
두 모드 모두에 새로운 심문 기능이 있습니다. 이것은 Rainbow Six Siege에서 Caveira의 오퍼레이터 능력과 매우 유사하게 작동합니다. 상대를 노크하면 플레이어가 "심문"하여 지도에서 분대원의 위치를 밝힐 수 있습니다.
또한 DMZ에만 있는 것처럼 보이는 것이 하나 있습니다. 플레이어는 매치 중 언제든지 죽은 위치에서 제거된 분대원을 부활시킬 수 있습니다. 죽은 팀원은 파란색 건강 아이콘으로 표시되며, 팀원을 경기에 복귀시키는 데 필요한 시간 제한이나 추가 단계가 없습니다.
공개 이벤트는 DMZ 플레이와 성공적인 추출에 대한 전반적인 보상과 장기적인 인센티브를 실제로 보여주지 않았습니다. 그러나 Activision은 다음 주 출시에 앞서 더 많은 정보가 공개될 것이라고 발표했습니다.
Modern Warfare 2 및 Warzone 2.0의 시즌 1은 개편된 전투 패스와 시즌 프레스티지 시스템의 주요 변경 사항을 포함하여 많은 새로운 콘텐츠와 변경 사항을 제공합니다. 콜 오브 듀티는 또한 세계에서 가장 유명한 축구/축구 선수 3명을 모던 워페어 2와 워존 2.0으로 데려오고 있으며, 모던 워페어 FC 이벤트는 시즌 1 출시 후 시작됩니다.
최고의 콜 오브 듀티: 터미네이터에서 스눕독까지 워존 라이센스 스킨
더보기
page_text_cn:
使命召唤：战区 2.0 将于 11 月 16 日随着现代战争 2：第 1 季的开始而发布，游戏将以使命召唤的新 DMZ 撤离模式发布。 Activision 一直没有透露细节，但内容创作者能够在 11 月 9 日的揭秘活动中直播 DMZ 的游戏玩法。在这里，我们分解了我们从活动中了解到的关于 DMZ 的所有信息。
DMZ 模式说明
Activision 对该模式的官方描述称，“DMZ 是一种开放世界、以叙事为中心的撤离模式，操作员小队可以自由完成基于派系的任务、承担额外的支线目标、与敌方操作员或 AI 战斗员交战，以及搜索 为了有价值的物品，一直在为逃亡而战。”
正在播放：COD 战区 2.0 新古拉格和地图说明 | GameSpot新闻
新的 DMZ 模式似乎是《使命召唤》对撤离射击游戏类型的演绎，玩家以三人组的形式进入 Warzone 的 Al Mazrah 地图，进行抢劫、战斗和撤离。 玩家可以完成一些目标以获得 XP 和现金，并且玩家可以选择他们想要玩的方式。 他们可以只是为了抢劫而参加一场比赛，他们可以选择寻找枪战，或者尝试完成特定目标。
就像《逃离塔科夫》和《狩猎：决战》等其他撤离射击游戏一样，玩家可以保留成功撤离时获得的所有武器和战利品，但如果他们在撤离前死亡，也会失去一切。
使用 Warzone 2.0 功能
玩家可以期待 DMZ 使用 Warzone 2.0 的许多功能和机制。 这包括 Al Mazrah 上的新要塞位置。 掠夺和拾取钥匙将使玩家能够获得在上锁的要塞建筑中发现的高级战利品。 地图上有几个要塞位置，每个键都分配给一个特定的要塞。 玩家可以选择进入要塞并清除任何 AI 对手以获得随机的高级战利品，或者可以在购买站出售钥匙以换取现金。
现代战争 2 的 AI 敌人遍布整个地图。 招募（简单）级别的 AI 散布在建筑物和各个位置，但据点或目标区域附近的 AI 通常都装有装甲，战斗起来更具挑战性。
DMZ 中还有一个背包系统，玩家从一个能装五件物品的小背包开始。 然而，更大的背包可以从购买站搜刮或购买。 这让玩家可以存储贵重物品，例如目标所需的物品或带有价格标签的随机垃圾，可以出售以换取现金。 这些物品包括食物、漫画书、电池和工具等。 一些工具似乎很有用，但不清楚有多少工具除了抢劫现金外还有其他用途。 然而，钻头可以被抢劫并用于打开保险箱，保险箱通常包含大量现金和无人机等有用物品。
在 DMZ 中非常强调获得大量金钱，这可能是因为购买站的高级物品需要大量现金。 Advanced UAV 连胜会在限定时间内显示地图上的所有玩家，每次连胜的费用为 12,000 美元。 升级到中型背包需要 5,000 美元，两板式装甲背心需要 7,500 美元。
战区和 DMZ 要塞位置
DMZ 还充分利用了 Al Mazrah 的所有车辆，这些车辆不再具有无限的燃料容量。 玩家需要用回收的汽油罐或在加油站为车辆加油，以保持比赛顺利进行。
两种模式都有一个新的审讯功能。 这很像《彩虹六号：围攻》中 Caveira 的操作员能力，击倒对手会让玩家“审问”他们以揭示他们队友在地图上的位置。
此外，还有一件事似乎是 DMZ 独有的。 玩家可以在比赛中随时在死亡地点复活被淘汰的队友。 死去的队友被标记为蓝色健康图标，没有时间限制，也没有任何额外的步骤可以让队友回到比赛中。
揭秘活动并没有真正展示玩 DMZ 和成功撤离的总体奖励和长期激励。 然而，Activision 确实宣布将在下周发布之前透露更多信息。
现代战争 2 和战区 2.0 的第 1 季带来了大量新内容和变化，包括全面修改的战斗通行证和季节性声望系统的重大变化。 使命召唤还将世界上最著名的三位足球运动员带到了现代战争 2 和战区 2.0，现代战争 FC 活动在第一季推出后开始。
最佳使命召唤：战区授权皮肤，从终结者到史努比狗狗
看更多
